body.p: We understand that there is in circulation in this vicinity a petition asking of you the remission of a fine, which was some years since assessed against Jno Blair who shortly afterwards removed to Misso: but is at this time here. The fine imposed has never been paid; It was for betting on an election. It so turned out that all of one party, (the old Whig party) who made bets, now fined and had the money to pay --

We earnestly hope that you will reject the petition unhesitatingly, for we do most solemnly assure you, that in our judgment a more consummate skamp does not live than this same Jno H Blair. We Know that the bet was made, and that the money was paid over to him.

To His Excellency
Gov. Robinson
